title: Electric potential - V at distance D from ring

content.question: A conducting ring of radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> has a net charge <math alttext="uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math>. Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> is located along the central axis of the ring at a distance <math alttext="uppercase D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> from the ring’s center, as shown in the figure. What is the electric potential at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator uppercase Q, and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times uppercase D, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>D</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator uppercase Q, and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times open parenthesis, uppercase D squared plus uppercase R squared, close parenthesis, raised to the one half power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator uppercase Q times uppercase R, and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times open parenthesis, uppercase D squared plus uppercase R squared, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator uppercase Q times uppercase D, and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times open parenthesis, uppercase D squared plus uppercase R squared, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator uppercase Q, and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times open parenthesis, uppercase D squared plus uppercase R squared, close parenthesis, raised to the one half power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
